授業目的:
The
purpose of this course is to provide students with a practical understanding of
research design and methods for conducting business research, with a particular
focus on marketing and consumer research.
到達目標:
Students will
     acquire a practical understanding of research, its structure, and
     processes.
 Students will
     be able to organize their research ideas and distinguish between good
     research and research that falls short of professional quality.
 Students will
     learn how to use AI tools responsibly and effectively to assist with
     research ideas and gather literature.
 Students will
     develop the ability to prepare a feasible and worthwhile proposal for the
     Individual Research course.
授業方法: In-person class discussion that include understanding research structure and its processes, developing research proposal and experiential learning presentation.

トピック.授業外学習2: This course is mainly for students who major in marketing. Before taking the course, students should have completed Statistic or Business Analytics course.

教科書/Required texts0:
Mark Saunders, Philip Lewis & Andrian Thornhill, Research Methods for Business Students, 5th Edition, Prentice-Hall, July 2009.

A selected article will be discussed at the beginning of the course to familiarize students with research structure and contents. Students are then expected to choose and review two articles relevant to their research interest in class discussions.
参考文献・資料/Reference books0: Paul Leedy, and Jeanne Ormrod, Practical Research:Planning and Design, 8th Edition, Pearson Prentice Hall, 2005.
